derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French appétissant, irregular formation from appétit (see appetite)

entry.tran: 色香俱佳的；引起食欲的
entry.def: Appetizing food looks and smells good, so that you want to eat it.

example.ex: ...the appetising smell of freshly baked bread...

means.word_mean: 1. appealing to or stimulating the appetite especially in appearance or aroma

auth_sentence.content: Sure to be appetizing to Linux users, MacOS X is open-source, and uses some FreeBSD code in its kernel, called Darwin.
